Issues.Title: feat(core): update assertDomNode to catch the case where a node comes from another frame
Issues.Body:
Previously if this function is used on a DOM node that is created by a frame other than the main one, it'll fail this assert.

A debug function `getDirectives`, eventually calls `assertDomNode` in its call tree. This caused an issue with Angular DevTools users who use third party scripts that:
1. creates an iframe
2. uses the iframes document to create a DOM element
3. injects that DOM element into the main document

This commit attempts to resolve this issue by augmenting assertDomNode to account for the case where a DomNode comes from another frame. Unfortunately there is no definitive way of doing this without having access to the frame in question, so we instead use a mostly accurate heuristic.

See #47357 for more context and a minimal reproduction of the issue.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "feat(core): update assertDomNode to catch the case where a node comes from another frame" (#47401)

Issues.Title: Allow injecting ComponentRef of a component through DI
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are relevant/related to the feature request?

core

### Description

As of angular 14 we have the new super useful `setInput` on `ComponentRef` for dynamic components. It finally allows fully CD aware dynamic inputs changing.
Currently if I want to extend a component with a directive and set inputs from it I need to do one of the two options:
1. Change the inputs statically in the constructor
2. Change inputs to get/set as `ngOnChanges` won't fire

### Proposed solution

Allowing to inject `ComponentRef` of the host component instead of the actual instance. This way we could just use `setInput` to update inputs and have a full CD aware binding support not through the template.

### Alternatives considered

1. Change the inputs statically in the constructor only - Can't apply to directive input based changes or observable based changes
2. Change inputs to get/set - Possible but annoying and "leaks" the knowledge of this component is being used from a directive outside. How can one explain why `ngOnChanges` was not used...
3. Maybe not through `ComponentRef` but as any other way to use `setInput` from DI injected components
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Allow injecting ComponentRef of a component through DI " (#47398)

Issues.Title: docs: replace deprecated --outFile option for ng extract-i18n
Issues.Body:
replace deprecated --outFile option for ng extract-i18n

The `--outFile` command option was last used in Angular v10 (back when it was still `ng xi18n`), yet there are still references to it in the documentation, alongside the up-to-date option `--out-file`. This PR replaces all mentions of the incorrect option with the correct writing.

Issues.Title: [14.2.x] fix(common): rename `rawSrc` -> `ngSrc` in NgOptimizedImage directive (#47362)
Issues.Body:
As an ongoing effort to stabilize the NgOptimizedImage API before existing the Developer Preview, this commit renames the `rawSrc` attribute used for the NgOptimizedImage selector matching to `ngSrc`. The `rawSrcset` is also renamed to `ngSrcset` for consistency.

The motivation for this change is to align the attribute name better with other built-in directives, such as `ngFor`, `ngIf`, `ngClass`, `ngStyle`, etc.

Note: this is technically a breaking change, but since the NgOptimizedImage directive is in the Developer Preview mode, we land the change in a patch branch.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "[14.2.x] fix(common): rename `rawSrc` -> `ngSrc` in NgOptimizedImage directive (#47362)" (#47396)

Issues.Title: Select attribute "multiple" always generates an array as resulting model
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are the source of the bug?

core

### Is this a regression?

No

### Description

By specification, the multiple attribute in a select should be boolean. 

The browsers seem to respect this attribute well, but in Angular I always get an array (model) as soon as the attribute is given, no matter what the value is.

This means that the use of `<select [multiple]="dynamicValue">...</select>` for single selects (with `dynamicValue = false`) is cumbersome because the resulting model is always an array.

### Please provide a link to a minimal reproduction of the bug

https://angular-ivy-xzpi8z.stackblitz.io

### Please provide the exception or error you saw

```true
Number 2 in the example link shows unexpected an behavior.
```


### Please provide the environment you discovered this bug in (run `ng version`)

```true
Angular 14 (see Stackblitz)
```


### Anything else?

_No response_
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Select attribute "multiple" always generates an array as resulting model" (#47386)

Issues.Title: Expose declarations property in NgModuleRef
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are relevant/related to the feature request?

core

### Description

What we are trying to reach:
render component dynamically by importing the angular module file and pick the component type from the module declarations without the need to import the component directly. 

We are using dynamic rendering for components in our app. Now as compileModuleAndAllComponentsSync is deprecated there is no angular way get a component type from an angular module file, which is needed to create a component dynamically using createComponent. 

We are aware that we can directly import an angular component but this does not match our application architecture. Cause we are bundling the lazy module in each module in a file and with the direct import of a component we get a bundle component per file.

Now we have a work around to access the declarations property of an NgModule by accessing the emod property, but it is probably not the appropriate way to do that. 

As Angular offers different ways to render components, it would be great to consider this scenario and offer a way to dynamically import components from module file. 


### Proposed solution

Angular should expose the declarations property in the NgModuleRef which is already loaded into emod property 

### Alternatives considered

accessing the emod property on the imported module to allow access to the module componets types
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Expose declarations property in NgModuleRef   " (#47387)

Issues.Title: Expose host binding info to template diagnostics
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are relevant/related to the feature request?

core

### Description

Many a11y checks would be enabled if we could analyze the host bindings of any directives on a node.

This would enable Extended Diagnostics to look at host bindings as well as the static template values, which enables better a11y diagnostics like:
- https://github.com/angular/angular/issues/46673
- https://github.com/angular/angular/issues/46670
- https://github.com/angular/angular/issues/46669

as well as additional context like:
- checking <div> is not used as an interact-able element (as a bad button replacement)
- invalid nesting (e.g. div inside h2)
+ more!
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Expose host binding info to template diagnostics" (#47374)

Issues.Title: Circular dependency issues are ignored
Issues.Body:
### Command

build

### Is this a regression?

- [ ] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

_No response_

### Description

Hi, In our library we hoped that the compiler would warn us about circular dependencies, but it does not complain at all. Currently, we use angular 14 with NX + nx executors, but angular builders do not say anything at all too.


### Minimal Reproduction

https://github.com/SAP/fundamental-ngx/issues/8664

_No response_

"@angular/cli": "~14.0.0",

I had to copy from package.json

Issues.Title: build: update Bazel to 5.3 and rules_pkg to 0.7.1
Issues.Body:
These updates have been combined as rules_pkg 0.7.1 requires support for non string labels which older versions of Bazel do not support which would cause the below failure

```
Error in select: select: got Label for dict key, want a label string
```
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "build: update Bazel to 5.3 and rules_pkg to 0.7.1" (#23888)

Issues.Title: perf(@ngtools/webpack): avoid bootstrap conversion AST traversal where possible
Issues.Body: To support AOT compilation the Angular bootstrap call needs to be converted from using `platform-browser-dynamic` to `platform-browser`. This transform was previously being executed against every source file within the program regardless of the presence of `platformBrowserDynamic`. An initial check is now performed that can avoid AST traversal when the bootstrapping call is not present in a file.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "perf(@ngtools/webpack): avoid bootstrap conversion AST traversal where possible" (#23880)

Issues.Title: [@angular-devkit/core v14.2.1] Error: Cannot find module '../operators/refCount'
Issues.Body:
### Command

serve

### Is this a regression?

- [X] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

v14.2.0

### Description

The module @angular-devkit\core\node_modules\rxjs missing refCount.js file.

### Exception or Error

```
node:internal/modules/cjs/loader:933
  const err = new Error(message);
              ^

Error: Cannot find module '../operators/refCount'
Require stack:
- D:\my-app\node_modules\@angular-devkit\core\node_modules\rxjs\internal\observable\ConnectableObservable.js
- D:\my-app\node_modules\@angular-devkit\core\node_modules\rxjs\index.js
- D:\my-app\node_modules\@angular-devkit\core\src\experimental\jobs\create-job-handler.js
- D:\my-app\node_modules\@angular-devkit\core\src\experimental\jobs\index.js
- D:\my-app\node_modules\@angular-devkit\core\src\experimental.js
- D:\my-app\node_modules\@angular-devkit\core\src\index.js
- D:\my-app\node_modules\@angular\cli\src\utilities\config.js
- D:\my-app\node_modules\@angular\cli\lib\init.js
    at Function.Module._resolveFilename (node:internal/modules/cjs/loader:933:15)
    at Function.Module._load (node:internal/modules/cjs/loader:778:27)
    at Module.require (node:internal/modules/cjs/loader:1005:19)
    at require (node:internal/modules/cjs/helpers:102:18)
    at Object.<anonymous> (D:\my-app\node_modules\@angular-devkit\core\node_modules\rxjs\internal\observable\ConnectableObservable.js:20:18)
    at Module._compile (node:internal/modules/cjs/loader:1105:14)
    at Object.Module._extensions..js (node:internal/modules/cjs/loader:1159:10)
    at Module.load (node:internal/modules/cjs/loader:981:32)
    at Function.Module._load (node:internal/modules/cjs/loader:822:12)
    at Module.require (node:internal/modules/cjs/loader:1005:19) {
  code: 'MODULE_NOT_FOUND',
  requireStack: [
    'D:\\my-app\\node_modules\\@angular-devkit\\core\\node_modules\\rxjs\\internal\\observable\\ConnectableObservable.js',
    'D:\\my-app\\node_modules\\@angular-devkit\\core\\node_modules\\rxjs\\index.js',
    'D:\\my-app\\node_modules\\@angular-devkit\\core\\src\\experimental\\jobs\\create-job-handler.js',
    'D:\\my-app\\node_modules\\@angular-devkit\\core\\src\\experimental\\jobs\\index.js',
    'D:\\my-app\\node_modules\\@angular-devkit\\core\\src\\experimental.js',
    'D:\\my-app\\node_modules\\@angular-devkit\\core\\src\\index.js',
    'D:\\my-app\\node_modules\\@angular\\cli\\src\\utilities\\config.js',
    'D:\\my-app\\node_modules\\@angular\\cli\\lib\\init.js'
  ]
}

Process finished with exit code 1
```

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/9401202/189102156-b6e275b2-60cf-4a74-afba-63aabb505d05.png)


### Minimal Reproduction

- Install angular v12.2.1
- Run `ng serve` or `ng build`
- You will got the error

### Your Environment

```text
Same error when run `ng version`.

OS: Windows 10
Node: v16.16.0
npm: 8.11.0

"@angular-devkit/build-angular": "14.2.1",
"@angular/cli": "14.2.1",
"@angular/compiler-cli": "14.2.1",
"@angular/service-worker": "14.2.1",
```


### Anything else relevant?

_No response_

Issues.Title: refactor(@angular-devkit/build-angular): remove `postcss-preset-env`
Issues.Body:
This change removes the usage of `postcss-preset-env` as this is no longer needed since Angular no longer supports browsers that require polyfills for CSS stage 3 features https://preset-env.cssdb.org/features/#stage-3.

We replace this and use autoprefixer directly which is still needed.

```
npx autoprefixer --info
Browsers:
  Chrome: 105
  Edge: 105, 104
  Firefox: 104, 102, 91
  iOS Safari: 15.6, 15.5, 15.4, 15.2-15.3, 15.0-15.1, 14.5-14.8, 14.0-14.4
  Safari: 15.6, 15.5, 15.4, 15.2-15.3, 15.1, 15, 14.1, 14

These browsers account for 20.38% of all users globally

At-Rules:
  @resolution: webkit

Selectors:
  ::backdrop: webkit
  ::file-selector-button: webkit
  :autofill: webkit
  :fullscreen: webkit

Properties:
  appearance: webkit
  backdrop-filter: webkit
  backface-visibility: webkit
  background-clip: webkit
  box-decoration-break: webkit
  color-adjust: webkit, moz
  hyphens: webkit
  mask-border-outset: webkit
  mask-border-repeat: webkit
  mask-border-slice: webkit
  mask-border-source: webkit
  mask-border-width: webkit
  mask-border: webkit
  mask-clip: webkit
  mask-composite: webkit
  mask-image: webkit
  mask-origin: webkit
  mask-position: webkit
  mask-repeat: webkit
  mask-size: webkit
  mask: webkit
  print-color-adjust: webkit, moz
  text-decoration-color: webkit
  text-decoration-line: webkit
  text-decoration-skip-ink: webkit
  text-decoration-skip: webkit
  text-decoration-style: webkit
  text-decoration: webkit
  text-size-adjust: webkit
  user-select: webkit

Values:
  cross-fade: webkit
  element: moz
  fill-available: webkit
  fill: webkit
  fit-content: moz
  image-set: webkit
  isolate: webkit
  stretch: webkit, moz
```

Issues.Title: bug(Overlay / Listbox): Error thrown when a listbox with cdkListboxMultiple is rendered inside an overlay
Issues.Body:
### Is this a regression?

- [ ] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

_No response_

### Description

When a listbox component is used inside an overlay, an error is thrown if the listbox contains multiple selected options 

### Reproduction

https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-ivy-cgbcrq?file=src/app/dropdown.component.ts


Steps to reproduce:
1. Open the console
2. Click 'toggle' to open the overlay then select 'Alpha'
3. Click 'toggle' to close the overlay
4. Click 'toggle' to open the overlay, then select 'Bravo'
5. Click 'toggle' to close the overlay
6. Click 'toggle' to open the overlay
7. Observe error in the console


### Expected Behavior

The list should render without error

### Actual Behavior

The following error is displayed in the console : 

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/13902975/189373992-abbf9971-54f3-4dec-b150-ec6e86b55353.png)


### Environment

- Angular:14
- CDK/Material: 14.2.1
- Browser(s): Chrome and Safari
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): macOS
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "bug(Overlay / Listbox): Error thrown when a listbox with cdkListboxMultiple is rendered inside an overlay" (#25611)

Issues.Title: fix(cdk/listbox): error with multiple preselected values
Issues.Body:
The CDK listbox had a subscription to its model changes in the constructor which fires immediately due to the `startsWith` and which was attempting to sort the selected values when in multiple selection mode. The problem is that the options aren't available until `ngAfterContentInit` which was causing an error when we tried to do the sorting.

These changes move the change event subscription to `ngAfterContentInit` so that options are guaranteed to be defined when it fires.

Fixes #25611.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "fix(cdk/listbox): error with multiple preselected values" (#25621)

Issues.Title: fix(material/button): cdk-focus classes not being applied
Issues.Body:
Fixes a bug in the Angular Material `button` component where cdk-focused, cdk-keyboard-focused, cdk-mouse-focused were not being applied upon respective focus. This is because there was no FocusManager set up with the MDC buttons like the legacy button did.

Fixes #25618
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(material/button): cdk-focus classes not being applied" (#25619)

Issues.Title: bug(Button): cdk-focus classes not being applied
Issues.Body:
### Is this a regression?

- [X] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

14.2.1

### Description

Buttons do not have `.cdk-focused`, `.cdk-keyboard-focused`, nor `.cdk-mouse-focused` classes applied upon focus, as seen in the [demo](https://next.material.angular.io/components/button/overview). Considering that [previous button behavior](https://material.angular.io/components/button/overview) apply those classes upon focus, this does not seem to be intended behavior.

### Reproduction

Steps to reproduce:
1. Focus button with mouse or keyboard
2. Examine button element in DevTools


### Expected Behavior

Upon focusing button with mouse, it should have both `.cdk-focused` and `.cdk-mouse-focused` classes applied to it. Upon focusing button with keyboard, it should have both `.cdk-focused` and `.cdk-keyboard-focused` classes applied to it.

### Actual Behavior

Upon focusing button with mouse and keyboard, no `.cdk-focused-*` classes were applied.

### Environment

- Angular: 15.0.0-next.0
- CDK/Material: 15.0.0-next.0
- Browser(s): Google Chrome
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): macOS
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "bug(Button): cdk-focus classes not being applied" (#25618)

Issues.Title: feat(material/tabs): ink bar animation synchronized with tab body
Issues.Body:
When the animation duration of the tab body was set to e.g. 0ms the ink bar still had an animation of 500ms. The following feat extends the animationDuration property to not only affect the tab body but also the ink bar of the tab group and the tab nav bar.

Fixes #25068

Issues.Title: bug(Tabs): Responsive arrow buttons are not fully accessible (Empty button error in WAVE)
Issues.Body:
### Is this a regression?

- [ ] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

_No response_

### Description

Checking the Tabs component through the WAVE Accessibility Tool, I get an error for the responsive arrow buttons:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/17402311/189393653-0e592352-48f4-4042-8f1e-e37084192261.png)
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/17402311/189393678-c4eab292-aecb-46a9-a8c1-982ede1977c8.png)

I checked the code and saw that **aria-hidden** is applied, which helps with screen reading, but accessibility tools still see the missing button text/aria-label as an issue...

### Reproduction

Steps to reproduce:
1. Install WAVE Accessibility tool https://chrome.google.com/webstore/detail/wave-evaluation-tool/jbbplnpkjmmeebjpijfedlgcdilocofh
2. Go to the Material page for Tabs (right now this link goes to version 14.2.1): https://material.angular.io/components/tabs/examples
3. Resize the window to a smaller width until the arrow buttons appear
4. Run WAVE on the page
5. Check the errors


### Expected Behavior

There should be no errors related to responsive arrow buttons

### Actual Behavior

There is an error for responsive arrow buttons: Empty button

### Environment

Whatever is running on the Material Official Website
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "bug(Tabs): Responsive arrow buttons are not fully accessible (Empty button error in WAVE)" (#25612)

Issues.Title: help(@angular/google-maps): Remove MapMarkers from Google Map component
Issues.Body:
### What are you trying to do?

I am trying to update my array of markers and replace my old markers on the map. Instead they are just adding on top of the other markers

### What troubleshooting steps have you tried?

I have tried changing my array to an observable array but I am having the same issue

### Reproduction

Steps to reproduce:
1. Create array for markers
`this.markers.push({
        position: {
          lat: lat,
          lng: lng,
        },
        options: {
          animation: google.maps.Animation.DROP,
        },
      });`
2. Display on map
`<google-map
      class="w-100 align-self-stretch"
      width="100%"
      (boundsChanged)="updateBounds()">
        <map-marker
          #markerElem="mapMarker"
          *ngFor="let marker of markers | async"
          [position]="marker.position"
          [label]="marker.label"
          [title]="marker.title"
          [options]="marker.options"></map-marker>
    </google-map>`
3. Update Markers array and see new markers just add on top of markers that are already there

### Environment

- Angular: 14.1.1
- CDK/Material:
- Browser(s): Opera, Chrome
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu):
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "help(@angular/google-maps): Remove MapMarkers from Google Map component" (#25610)

Issues.Title: fix(material/menu): update submenu indication when menu is assigned
Issues.Body: In #24437 we added the ability to conditionally remove a menu from a menu trigger. The problem is that the flag that determines if the menu item has the small triangle indicator is only set in the constructor. These changes move the logic to the setter and add a `markForCheck` to ensure that the view is in sync.

Issues.Title: bug(Tab bar nav): 508 Compliance Issue
Issues.Body:
### Is this a regression?

- [X] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

13.2.3

### Description

The button that is used to navigate the tab structure is not assigned a value or text.  This is causing 508 compliance issues for accessibility.  There is no way we've found via css or otherwise to access the button to either give it text or value.

### Reproduction

Steps to reproduce:
1. Place a nav mat-tab-nav-bar component with items on a page.
2.  Examine page in browser with a tool that evaluates accessibility - ie 'WAVE Evaluation Tool' extention for Chrome


### Expected Behavior

We should be able to access the button to either give it value text or have a way so if its disable to not even render it on that screen.

### Actual Behavior

The button is present and we are unable to access it through any available methods or properties to give it a value or text  or hide it.

### Environment

- Angular:
- CDK/Material:
- Browser(s):
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu):
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "bug(Tab bar nav): 508 Compliance Issue" (#25604)

Issues.Title: ci: re-enable until front of line blocking in publish snapshot job
Issues.Body:
We had to temporarily disable the CircleCI orb command that helps ensuring snapshot jobs
do not conflict when running concurrently.

It seems like the CircleCI API has been fixed to no longer cause issues with the Orb. This commit
attempts to re-enable the command.

Issues.Title: docs-bug(mat-paginator): Consider documenting ability to change styling for page size dropdown
Issues.Body:
### Documentation Feedback

As highlighted in https://github.com/angular/components/pull/18800, the page size dropdown looks wrong if a default formfield style is set globally.

Based on this page, the recommendation is to avoid using the "standard" or "legacy" setting for formfield appearance: https://material.angular.io/components/form-field/overview

It therefore seems to make sense to set a global default, but this breaks the page size dropdown.

My understanding is that overriding this is a case of adding a provider as follows:

```ts
        {
            provide: MAT_PAGINATOR_DEFAULT_OPTIONS,
            useValue: { formFieldAppearance: 'legacy' }
        }
```

Should this be documented?

### Affected documentation page

https://material.angular.io/components/paginator/overview
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "docs-bug(mat-paginator): Consider documenting ability to change styling for page size dropdown" (#25597)
